intro: Clidemia trichotoma, commonly known as the hairy false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Clidemia trichotoma is also known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets, making it an invasive species in some areas.
